website_summaries.verdict: Strong dog tie-out stake that offers good value and works with large dogs.
pros: Consists of 100% steel and an 18" length, so it will keep larger dogs secure
Rated to handle dogs up to 150 lbs
Uses a dome-shaped piece at the top that keeps the cable free from tangles
Good price point, even though you have to provide your own tie-out cable
cons: Must have a hammer or mallet to properly drive the stake

customer_reviews.title: Worthless and unreliable!
customer_reviews.text: My dog was in the street when I came home last night. Boyfriend had her out on the tie out, and it appears the metal piece completely broke open. Likely if she ran after a rabbit or something. Scared me senseless as I almost hit her with my car!! I've had other stakes that she has bent and twisted and thought this would work well considering it said up to 100 lbs and she's only 65 lbs! Cheaply made and not reliable. She could've been hurt, I'm so angry! We have only used it for two weeks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought two of these stakes to use at campgrounds when we take our dogs. The stakes are very sturdy and easy to hammer into the ground. I like that the dogs can move around freely and still stay within our area. It's very nice to be able to easily move the stakes to follow the shady areas. The stakes are very strong and have never been pulled out of the ground by our large athletic dogs. We even bought a 3rd stake to use to tie our fishing boat to shore at the lake. Will definately recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Does the job on my 40lb pooch
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly suitable for my Corgi X rottie. She is 40lbs and pretty well behaved so when I attach her to this she knows she is not going anywhere. Have not had a problem with her trying to dig it up and it's permanently rooted in our little garden for those just in case I need to put her on moments. It's fairly sturdy though and doesn't move. The little ring you attach it to moves around so it has give and moves with the dog minimising restrictions. So far it does the job...very pleased with my purchase and the cost of it.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: I like it overall, but the rusting was the problem.
customer_reviews.text: I am using it for two dogs, both less than 20lbs. But I like to go the extra step and got the largest one. Works wonderfully. Stays put in the ground. The only problem is that the swivel part has become extremely rusted and does not swivel properly anymore. Also, be careful of the length. Since it is so long, make sure there is nothing in the ground it can damage. When my dad was installing it, he hit the septic tank. So be careful of that.
customer_reviews.author: SnarlaScruffles

customer_reviews.title: Great for desert ground
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of these to use when camping with our two dogs... a 50lb husky mix and English Bulldog. We live in the desert of CA and needed something that would stay in the ground and not bend when we hit rocks. These did the job! They were easy to put into place and dint budge once in... even with the constant pulling our dogs did. They are also easy to remove from the growing using the claw part of a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: KristinTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Definitely holds my dogs when they are individually tied up, whether they are on full charge mode or just walking around. I have attached 2 leads and temporarily tethered both dogs but not long enough for them to both be pulling on it full strength. I don't know if I'll test that. I have a male Rottweiler and a female Rottweiler mix
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Very good value, very good design with high-quality materials.
customer_reviews.text: High quality construction, heavy duty material equals my 150 pound goat staying put. LOL she “Mabel” Is harder on a tie out cable than any large breed dog I could imagine. I found this steak out to be an exceptional value very well-designed and as stated heavy duty. Would highly recommend it for any large animal that has to be cabled in a specific area etc..
customer_reviews.author: REP

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is intended for. Our 4 month ...
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is intended for. Our 4 month German Shepard gets to go out and we have a 25ft strong plastic cord to run around since we don't have a fence yet. Its very strong and doesn't budge much. Our puppy has learned to dig around it to try to free herself, but we put a cone over it =) One thing I would suggest, after I bought this, I saw another version in a store that has a spring at the end of the hoop, which might help when the dogs just starting to see how far they can go, so they have some room to not simply choke themselves.
customer_reviews.author: L. Torres

customer_reviews.title: Too good, actually
customer_reviews.text: There's a campsite that I've donated this stake to, because I couldn't get it out of the ground after camping... Good news is my 30lb dog couldn't get it out either! Turns out I drove the stake into a large tree root.... oops. 4 stars because I think the design is flawed - how are you supposed to remove this device? I guess dig a hole around it? Also, the metal flange at the top (the flatish circular bit) is too plyable - I bent it easily with my rubber mallet while trying to remove it from the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Monroe E.

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for us, but probably ok for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: I keep thinking, like an idiot, that maybe one of these would hold, but sadly no. Just can’t use these stakes. Ended up getting a stake that pivots on a ring and is flush to the ground. I’m sure this would work for small dogs though. Can be difficult to get it into the ground. Pouring warm water over the area first and give it a few seconds and that sort of helps.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget Girl

customer_reviews.title: Tough and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This stake withstood my 100+ lb German Shepard. He destroyed a cheaper one I had gotten at a famous retailer. Strong. Durable. High quality welds. Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Paul W. Kirchubel

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Like pounding a stake into the ground. That is all I have good to say about it. Pulled right out, so I truly doubt it would hold a 150 pound dog. I am 134 pound woman and it came right out, no matter where it was placed. I ended up digging up my old one with collapsible side wings and reused it. Piece of garbage and you should be ashamed of yourself for selling something that is absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Inga L Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value. Using this for a 30 lb lab mix. Hammered it flush to the ground. At first he made some fast pulls and it moved in the earth slightly but held strong. Love that I can take the leash off and just mow over it with the lawn mower without any issues. Keep in mind the weight/power of your dog and the strength of your soil.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Useful for So Many Other Things
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace flimsy tent stakes that came with a portable carport a couple of months ago. Let me tell you, I'm SO glad I did! Last weekend we had very strong winds (strong enough to break large tree branches) and 4 of these stakes held our portable carport down like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: D. McCaskill

customer_reviews.title: Held up on a 60 pound husky
customer_reviews.text: Really strong material I have a husky weights about 60 pounds. I took this camping twice, once to the park and as held up great. On the first trip he saw a bunny and took off full force I got scared that he would tear it out but didn't. Make sure the ground soil is not too loose or they might pull it out. So far my dog hasn't been able to and has tested it a few times. It takes a couple of mins to install int he ground and to take off I find it a bit harder taking off I use a hammer just have patience.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product for our 25lb male Corgi. We use it at the beach and it's perfect for the sand. We live in Florida and the beach we frequent has white sugar sand. It works great. You can't beat it for the price. We just make sure to rinse and dry it off after each use so the salt doesn't rust it.
customer_reviews.author: Betina26

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Simpl, cheap, and does what it's supposed to do. I have goats and I use these stakes to anchor the goats down so they don't run off. They're sturdy enough for a medium dog, anything bigger and I'd buy a more robust version of these stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Vigilant Lance

customer_reviews.title: Hard time fitting a tie on the loop
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and stays in the ground nicely. But the hook where you attach the tie is too thick. I have 3 different ties and none of them fit this. I had to rig it to work but I wish that piece of metal was thinner so it could fit a clip on it
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Extremely sturdy. I'm pretty sure you could tie an elephant to this thing and it would stay put. Not actually, but I cannot get over how solidly constructed this stake is and although it's difficult to get into the ground, it's nearly impossible to get it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product so my dog could run around the yard while waiting for the rest of our fence to be put up. First off, it’s very hard to get into the ground. I do like how it doesn’t allow for the chain/ lead to get tangled. Secondly, when it rains, it can and will be pulled out of the ground if you have a larger dog. Lastly, it is not as strong as you would think the bottom of the pole was bent when my German Shepherd pulled it from the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy post and a safe tieout for my big dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes to visit neighbors, this tieout doesn't tangle and keeps her safe from traffic and getting into things where she doesn't belong. Even in thunder storms she stay's where she belongs and is safe
customer_reviews.author: dreamer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stake. I have a 50 lb. Boxer mix that is very strong and she has not been able to pull the stake out of the ground. All other stake designs we tried she could pull straight out.
customer_reviews.author: CatCatDog

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!!! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I must say this is the best dog stakes I ever owned. I have a 90lb pitbull that loves to tug and pull. This thing will hold him with no problems. It's very reliable and heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: ExtendedRoar

customer_reviews.title: Took the lawnmower Two tries
customer_reviews.text: This thing held up to not one but TWO run ins with the lawnmower before it gave up. Until then it kept my 75+lb German Shepherd safely secured to the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: This Thing Works Well but Needs A User-Friendly Handle
customer_reviews.text: I have two smaller dogs, the heaviest weighing about 17lbs. I've used it at a park and it worked fine. We went after a recent rain so the ground wasn't too hard, but jeez! It was a bit difficult turning the stake down into the soil. I would say the one improvement would be to add a rubberized handle or cover.
customer_reviews.author: Dess

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain for the price!
customer_reviews.text: We used this stake on camping trips all we could tie out our dog, and it was great while we had it. We only got a couple of uses from it until the metal bent. The metal is quite soft and the spike isn't very thick so it will bend if you're not careful when driving it into the ground, or you hit a rock like I did!! At least it was cheap!
customer_reviews.author: chelksea

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my 65# who needs to stay in her yard!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for months and has stood up. Low profile is great for mowing over. Has kept my girl from jumping my fence :)
customer_reviews.author: Psychdrk

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you're looking for
customer_reviews.text: You get exactly what is pictured - a very sturdy twist down stake. If you haven't used one with your dog before you'll want to take into consideration how desperately your dog wants to get away, but I can't imagine the size and strength a dog would need to pull this out of the ground. The best part is how easy it is to put in and take out. We got ours for camping and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: JLB

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an old broken one. Our husky is leashed to this when he goes out. We have had this set up for a few months now and it shows no signs of rust or excessive wear. I have had some break after only a month or two, but this one seems to be very durable and strong! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Rust!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and designed like any other ground stake, but it rusts! Rust is happening at the top of the steam were ther lead would spin. I have only used it for little over a month and we are not sure how much longer will be able to use it before it breaks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy, but unfortunately our dog doesn't like to run around while attached to it. She just wants to stand still and eat grass. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Addran09

customer_reviews.title: This spiral tie out does a great job of staying in place in the ground even ...
customer_reviews.text: This spiral tie out does a great job of staying in place in the ground even during the changing seasons it doesn't seem to budge. it was very easy to insert into the ground though.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Better than the twist-in kind
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great! It works so much better than those twist-in stakes. Even if it isn't pushed in all the way it still works really well. If the ground is hard, you can hammer it in. It's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Puppy Lover 2016

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid piece. I have a 60lb and a 40lb dog that wrestle hard and this stake hasn't budged. We get a fair amount of rain which worried me a bit but it hasn't moved one bit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Heller

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for our small dog
customer_reviews.text: Only used for a short time while working on our fence but it worked perfectly for our 20 pound pug.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Fits snugly into the ground. We use it with a 30' tie out for our young goats in the pasture, so they don't run off. We've used other stakes before and the lead would always get tangled around the top of the stake. This one is very heavy duty and the goats don't get tangled!
customer_reviews.author: Wen

customer_reviews.title: pretty lightweight and not very long so could pull out ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty lightweight and not very long so could pull out of the ground if you used it with a large, strong dog that was determined to not be restricted by a chain or tie out.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara G

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Love these, had one before. It got ripped up by a back hoe. Still worked but got a new one anyway
customer_reviews.author: Donna J. Surich

customer_reviews.title: live on rocks
customer_reviews.text: I live on top of straight rocks. like, you dig and rocks, you dig some more.. more rocks. This worked perfect, didnt break didnt bend. and keeps my 90LBS husky locked down. Great products will def buy more.
customer_reviews.author: AimieeDawn

customer_reviews.title: Let the dogs out!
customer_reviews.text: works perfectly. Have not had any issues with the item coming out of the ground even, with two dogs tied to it. Exactly what we needed and I love that it gives my pets to freedom to go all around the yard
customer_reviews.author: LoriL1970

customer_reviews.title: Good Design, Poor Execution
customer_reviews.text: The very first time we used it, the wings on the bottom broke off in pretty soft soil. The welds just aren't sufficient. It gets two stars because the design is good and it would be a great product if the QC was improved. Even with the wings (unknowingly) separated from the stake, it did keep our 40lb hound puppy in place, although he really didn't tug at it beyond the first couple minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put into ground and also to remove from ground with little damage to the area. I’m using for 2 dogs over 80 lbs with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Tough piece
customer_reviews.text: I mow my lawn twice a week and for 3 months I pull this thing out for each mowing the pound it back into ground. Plus we use this when we take the dog places. It absorbs all the abuse. Only surface rust on part that gets hammered. For the price it's totally worth it
customer_reviews.author: Buck_Hunter 107

customer_reviews.title: Hound dog anchor for those necessary moments.
customer_reviews.text: This will be used to anchor my little Havanese when they 'gotta go.' A recent fracture prevents me from walking them my hope is that we can train my boys to go out and return because they are currently boarded away from home and I miss my boys.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy!! This thing is a piece of junk. Used once and it bent. I was using it in pretty soft dirt with no rocks. I wouldn’t trust my dog attached to this.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough to hold our two high-energy 50+ lbs pups. Their ties did get tangled, but that's expected and virtually unavoidable if you want them on the same stake or close enough to play. Paint did chip off the top when hammering it in, even though we tried to protect it with towels - but it still functions perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TRNeuTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Broke in Half at Installation!
customer_reviews.text: While screwing it in the handle broke off!! Can't not even get it out of the ground to return it! Do not order this product!
customer_reviews.author: Any E

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works as should. Able to remove cable and mow over without hitting
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This goes into the ground very deep. This is the second one we've purchased, the first one lasted 4 years. And the little ring that the lead hooks to finally broke in -20 degree temperatures. So all in all, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy W

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy in-ground hold
customer_reviews.text: We've had tons of rain lately, and even so, this item has held firm in the ground. Very pleased and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: metal spiral tieout
customer_reviews.text: is a little wobbly when our gumbo dirt is wet but 115 lb dog hasn't managed to remove it yet. we use sparingly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok for smaller dogs
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t hold up my German Shepherd pup who was only 70 pounds. A shame because it was really hefty upon arrival, now it’s all bent. Still held him but can’t use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect for my min would also be fine for heavier ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality stake. Worked perfect for my min would also be fine for heavier dogs probably up to 40 or 50 pounds. Can't go wrong with the price. Be sure to use a towel on top when hammering it into the ground to prevent knocking the paint off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing!!! I have a 70 lb pit bull that is stronger than any other dog I have met. It has worked against all types of pulling. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my dog!
customer_reviews.text: This works great when I want some quiet time and send my dog outside. I was able to easily put it in the ground and its pretty sturdy in there! No complaints here. super simple and no tools needed to get it in the ground properly.
customer_reviews.author: faraway12

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: My 60lb pit hasn't pulled it out of the ground yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough to hold an 80lb pitbull
customer_reviews.text: Works great, stays in the ground and super durable. I have a pitbull that is 80lb of pure muscle and this works well for her!!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Nordwind

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and strong!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. We used it on our road trip with our 50 pound dog and it's taken plenty of abuse from lawnmowers and from using a hammer instead of a mallet to pound it in. The turning top is great to keep your leash tangle free. Easy to put into the ground and takes just a little effort to pull it back out.
customer_reviews.author: Andre H.

customer_reviews.title: Holds my 125 Mastiff- Lab mix.
customer_reviews.text: I don't worry about her running off now when i go somewhere. I bought an expensive strong collar and a 250 lb. Plastic coated steel cable to use with this. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: M Ram

customer_reviews.title: It works! I had my friends huge pit bull ...
customer_reviews.text: It works! I had my friends huge pit bull attached to it at the beach and it held strong the entire day.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Burke

customer_reviews.title: It will stay put
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid tie out. I have a large and growing pup who has put this to the test. It hasn’t budged.
customer_reviews.author: CombatGirl

customer_reviews.title: works fantastic
customer_reviews.text: hold my German shepherd in the yard with his cable like a charm no issues goes deep into the ground.happy I purchased this
customer_reviews.author: gummybear

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It works and has held up for 3 labs and 1 pittbull.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. I’ve gone through a few stakes . This one does not lose nor move. I have a 70lb husky tied to it and it’s stays secure at all times.
customer_reviews.author: David Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used several of these to hold a tarp down and they've worked well
customer_reviews.author: try4

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Keep it on the side yard and low ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Keep it on the side yard and low enough to the ground where I dont need to remove it when mowing the grass. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Bennett

customer_reviews.title: nice for our small dog so far
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality metal. I hate screwing it into the ground. The tip is still sharp and the spiral is still straight. Our dog is only about 11#'s so she has not really tested this.
customer_reviews.author: dogpile

customer_reviews.title: Good low profile stake
customer_reviews.text: Great for staking out my 70 lb dog. Plus no tangles,
customer_reviews.author: qwerty

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Construction!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by the heavy duty construction of this Tie down stake. It went into the ground easily and I think it will hold up for many years to come. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Marta Von Runge

customer_reviews.title: Works and keeps the doggie in the yard
customer_reviews.text: It keeps the doggie in the yard. Not much else to say about it. Paired with the add on 30' med duty tie out cable.
customer_reviews.author: William Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Works great and never had a problem with it coming out ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this all weekend camping with my two dogs. Works great and never had a problem with it coming out of the ground even when the dogs pulled.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it looks like there are rocks in my soil and they just ...
customer_reviews.text: The stakes appear to be well made, but I was never able to get one into the ground, it looks like there are rocks in my soil and they just does not let the stakes go into the ground, perhaps they will work on different soil, but they did not work on mine.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben C.

customer_reviews.title: I had to hammer this bad boy into the ground
customer_reviews.text: So effective I couldn't get it back out of the ground LOL! No need to worry about your pup pulling this thing out of the ground. I had to hammer this bad boy into the ground. There was no chance of getting it back.
customer_reviews.author: Ortiz family

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This is not anything but heavy duty!! It looks like a missile in the ground, lol, but it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leash clip broke right off
customer_reviews.text: The ring to which you clip the leashes broke right off when my dog ran. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: C1

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great valve and works exceptionally well. I drove them down till the top flange is a flush with ground which lets me move over them with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Poppabear

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: did not think it would hold my big dog but it does hold it
customer_reviews.author: Medina

customer_reviews.title: Broke during the second use!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. The top of this broke off during the second use. Our dog is 70lbs and was not running or jumping and it popped off. Its dangerous to market this as durable. Amazon is kindly issuing us a refund. We will not purchase from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: Not very good- bent the first time it was used by my 40# dog.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best investment!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, has not budged from my 60lb Husky that is a year old with an over abundance of energy!
customer_reviews.author: Jolynn

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Used this for our 135lb Great Dane, used a hammer to install into the ground
customer_reviews.author: BIG GERM

customer_reviews.title: Solid!!
customer_reviews.text: Tough and does not bend when my 50lb dog pulls full force.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: This is heavy duty and won't pull out of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty and won't pull out of the ground. Our dog is a bit small, but mighty, and I don't worry about the durability of this stake at all.
customer_reviews.author: thriftymom

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a medium dog
customer_reviews.text: This works well for my 22 pound shiba inu. We have used this in so many traveling situations with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Pupster

customer_reviews.title: No more untangling the doggie
customer_reviews.text: Used this for camping. Works perfectly for a herding dog that makes 20 circles before laying day. Hard to pound into ground but easy to remove.
customer_reviews.author: jessica hale

customer_reviews.title: Works great and a great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this we use it camping with our small dog. Great price as well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I was able to straighten it out in a table vise and get it into soft ground eventually and it works great, but it seems more flexible than expected upon ...
customer_reviews.text: Bent as soon as I tried to stake it into the ground. I was able to straighten it out in a table vise and get it into soft ground eventually and it works great, but it seems more flexible than expected upon installation.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Dinovo

customer_reviews.title: Low profile and strong
customer_reviews.text: Long enough and stronger than our big dog! Very low profile so mowing and gardening is unhampered.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Dunn

customer_reviews.title: dog stake
customer_reviews.text: got this for my small dog who kept on breaking 1/8 th inch cables and pulling out stakes. Well we used this this last camping trip. He pulled it out about half way, broke the side fins off, and bent it about 45 degrees. He is only 22 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Ornelas

customer_reviews.title: I really prefer this to the cork screw looking version ...
customer_reviews.text: I really prefer this to the cork screw looking version. They go all the way into the ground and don't get in the way if walking or tangle nearly as much.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyna

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 4 month old, 26 lb husky mix. I put it in the yard weeks ago, and he hasn't come anywhere near close to pulling it out. It's very convenient for when I take him out for a good bath and brushing.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Jones

customer_reviews.title: One wrong push into the ground and the whole thing ...
customer_reviews.text: One wrong push into the ground and the whole thing went crooked...after that, my dog could wiggle himself free...which was definitely not the plan while camping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Best out there! I have two 130 pound dogs on it too!
customer_reviews.text: Thank YOU!!! Finally a product that works! Thus thing could hold a horse. Lol. Amazing item. Thank you for solving my problem!
customer_reviews.author: Adam B.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This product worked perfectly for us we have a 75 pound Labradoodle. It went into the ground very nice and smooth. Much better than the spiral ones.
customer_reviews.author: C.D.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, great value
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. As another reviewer pointed out, the triangle shape is not welded closed, but for my purposes (Anchoring garden equipment so it doesn't blow away) that is not a problem
customer_reviews.author: Master Tinkerer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality stake with sturdy ring. Easy to put into the ground. Large dog wasn't able to pull it out of the ground. Well worth saving the money on this one. Easily attach any length of tie out cable.
customer_reviews.author: KaseyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wings broke IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: The "wings" that hold these in the soil broke off the first time we used them. The ground was wet after 3 days of rain, so there wasn't much force on them to cause the damage.
customer_reviews.author: Skull Crusher

customer_reviews.title: It isn't very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: If you have soft ground, I suppose it's okay. However, I hand-turned it around a couple rocks and it snapped in half. It isn't very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Trillium

customer_reviews.title: I have a 38lb mix breed, and I attached ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 38lb mix breed, and I attached a "large weight tie out" to this stake. My dog took off running at her assumed freedom, and the round hook snapped in half. It lasted all of 15 seconds. I had to rig the tie out to the stake to make it work, and even so, it's not idea but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha

customer_reviews.title: very strong, we got these to tie down our ...
customer_reviews.text: very strong, we got these to tie down our shed and coop during hurricane Irma, they did not budge and kept everything safe!
customer_reviews.author: trisha

product_meta.title: Pet Champion 18 Inch Steel Metal Spiral Tie Out Stake
product_meta.description:
Size:Extra LargePet Champion 18 Inch Heavy Duty Steel Dome Top Tie Out Stake with Stabilizing Wings for Dogs up to 150 Pounds, Extra Large

Features:

The Pet Champion 18 Inch Heavy Duty Steel Dome Top Tie Out Stake with Stabilizing Wings for Dogs up to 150 Pounds, Extra Large is intended for use with Pet Champion Tie Out Cables, but can also serve many other uses such as securing tents or tarps. The 18 Inch Steel Heavy Duty Stake is easily driven into even rocky or hard soil to anchor a tie out system. The Pet Champion Steel Heavy Duty Stake is constructed with 100% pure steel for superior strength and durability. The dome head of this stake provides added protection against your pet's cable tangling. This Stake can stand up to the tugging and playing of most large breed Dogs up to 100 pounds with the help of 4 stabilizing wings. Stake and tie out systems are ideal for camping and yards without fences. These systems offer your pet the freedom to play, but stay safely in sight.

Instructions for use:


 * Place Tie Out Stake in desired location, an area relatively flat and free of obstacles.
 * Make sure the stake is vertical.
 * Strike the top of the Stake until the four wings come into contact with the ground.
 * Pound the stake into the ground until dome is level with ground surface.



Availability:

 * Extra Large: Pet Champion 18 Inch Heavy Duty Steel Dome Top Tie Out Stake with Stabilizing Wings for Dogs up to 150 Pounds
 * Large: Pet Champion 14 Inch Steel Metal Dome Tie Out Stake for Dogs up to 100 Pounds
 * Standard: Pet Champion 18 Inch Steel Metal Spiral Tie Out Stake
feature_bullets: Pet Champion Extra Large Heavy Duty Stake is intended for use with Pet Champion Tie Out Cables
This 100% steel stake can stand up to the tugging and playing of most large breeds up to 150 pounds with the help of 4 stabilizing wings
Extra Large Heavy Duty Stake is best for use with rocky or hard soil and is rust resistant
Dome head of this stake helps prevent your pet's tie out from becoming tangled
Stake and tie out systems are ideal for camping and yards without fences
